intro: Cynoglossum yemenense, commonly known as Yemen hound's tongue, is a flowering plant native to Yemen. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, tongue-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in rocky, arid environments. It is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soil. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
